results.title: The Bus trip
results.brief_description: Ever gone on a trip and thought that maybe you left the oven on at home? In this entertaining film these kinds of speculations turn a simple cross country bus trip into a nightmare. Original Format 35mm/colour.

results.title: Dusty hearts
results.creator_credit: Pauline Chan, Mariel Beros and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Sax Elthan is a hapless musician, a refugee from the inner city. Rejected by his girlfriend, he travels to the outback to look for work. One burning Wednesday he finds himself beside a highway, waiting for a lift, contemplating his future. It arrives in the shape of a beat-up Volkswagon with a wardrobe tied to the roof. A black comedy about one man’s destiny starring Geoff Morrell (Blue Heelers, Changi). Also features Tina Bursill.

results.brief_description: Driving a taxi is not so bad if you’re really an actor researching a part or a writer looking for material. Features a cameo by Australian great, Jack Thompson. Original format 16mm.

results.title: Wild planet
results.brief_description: George Bonicelli is an unassuming, naive and likable accountant who has his routine and mundane existence briefly injected with a large dose of fear, exhilaration, speed, colour, movement, liberation and a hint of romance when he runs into Leilah Deluxe, a 340 year old woman from the planet Ultra Terra. Original format 16 mm/colour.

results.title: Roadside cafe
results.brief_description: A lonely young woman working in an isolated roadhouse is desperate to escape the inevitability of her future. She makes hopeful overtures toward the only people that she meets - the truckies and families who frequent the cafe but is met with ugliness and hostility. Cast features LeVerne McDonnell. Original format 16mm/colour.

group_siblings.title: Bullet proof and blind
group_siblings.creator_credit: Paul Healy, Ruth Kleinhenz, AFTRS and Alexandra Long

results.title: Projected Memories: Work in old films
results.brief_description: ‘Projected memories: work in old films’. In 1947, a projectionist took a collection of instructional 16mm films about work to the bush. This short film includes excerpts from that collection covering early footage (1900s-1930s) of families on the land; factory workers; steel workers; coal miners; working women; the rise of trade-unions and the 8-hour day; peace campaign of 1938; the invention of the teleprinter; the arrival of the corner grocer shop and much more.

group.title: Another day, another dollar: three short films about the history of work

group_siblings.title: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History
Never Done: Women, Work and History

results.title: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History
results.brief_description: It was government policy for First Nations peoples in Australia to assimilate to the white ethics of education and work. Then came the mission stations, removal of children, forced labour often in the most deplorable conditions, exploitation and even when First Nations Australians were trained in skilled work through the mission stations, white Australians would not employ them - all this most comprehensively portrayed by the archival footage in this film.

results.title: End of the Line
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival. Fleeing from town, a small child finds himself hiding in a seemingly deserted railway station. One day he is crossing the tracks when a train come hurtling towards him. A beautifully photographed film, imbued with feelings of isolation and loneliness.
